titleStmt.title: A pleasant new ballad of the Miller of Mansfield, in Sherwood and of King Henry the second, and how he was lodged in the millers house, and of their pleasant communication To the tune of, The French Lavolta.
Pleasant ballad of King Henry II. and the miller of Mansfield.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A06253 of text S904 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 16740). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

publicationStmt.publisher: for E. Wright, dwelling at Christ-Church Gate,

notesStmt.note: An edition of: A pleasant ballad of King Henry II. and the miller of Mansfield.
Verse - "Henry our royall King would ride a hunting,".
Identified as Wing P2554A(a) on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1641-1700", reel 2123.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
